p: Between 2013 and 2017, a total of 1556 laboratory-confirmed human infection with A (H7N9) virus were reported in mainland China, with 145 cases reported in 2013, 314 cases in 2014, 208 cases in 2015, 130 cases in 2016 and 759 cases in 2017. The epidemic spread to most provinces except Heilongjiang, Hainan, Qinghai, and Ningxia. The cases mainly located in the Yangtze River Delta in eastern China and southern China, i.e. Zhejiang (20.81%), Guangdong (16.63%), and Jiangsu (15.35%) ( Fig 2).
